intro: Zahlbrucknera conferta, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caribbean, characterized by its dense, velvety foliage. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, typically displaying shades of white or pale blue. Zahlbrucknera conferta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
